intro: Dasyphyllum colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian dasyphyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
